---
title: "Checking and accepting a pull request"
---
After a collaborator has initiated a merge request, the repository owner generally reviews and accepts pull requests.

To accept a submitted pull request, follow these steps (see @fig-pullchecking):

 1.   Go to the **Pull requests** tab in the GitHub repository [[-]{style="color: #143D59"}A[-]{style="color: #143D59"}]{style="color: white; font-weight: bold; background-color: #143D59; border-radius: 50%;"}. Here, you'll find a list of requests where you can take various actions.
 2.   Access a specific request by clicking on the pull request name [[-]{style="color: #143D59"}B[-]{style="color: #143D59"}]{style="color: white; font-weight: bold; background-color: #143D59; border-radius: 50%;"}. 

This allows you to thoroughly review the proposed changes and decide whether to accept, request modifications, or close the request.


![Checking a pull request on GitHub.](images/pullchecking.svg){#fig-pullchecking .absolute top=160 left=380 width="600"}


@fig-descriptionpulling displays the content of a pull request, providing information on the commit [[-]{style="color: #143D59"}A[-]{style="color: #143D59"}]{style="color: white; font-weight: bold; background-color: #143D59; border-radius: 50%;"} and the request description [[-]{style="color: #143D59"}B[-]{style="color: #143D59"}]{style="color: white; font-weight: bold; background-color: #143D59; border-radius: 50%;"}. Using **Add a comment** section [[-]{style="color: #143D59"}C[-]{style="color: #143D59"}]{style="color: white; font-weight: bold; background-color: #143D59; border-radius: 50%;"}, both the repository owner and contributor can exchange messages for clarifications before proceeding to merge [[-]{style="color: #143D59"}D[-]{style="color: #143D59"}]{style="color: white; font-weight: bold; background-color: #143D59; border-radius: 50%;"}.

After the pull request has been accepted and merged, its status will transition from **Open** to **Merged**. Additionally, if the branch is no longer needed, it can be safely deleted.


![Description of an opened pulling request.](images/descriptionpulling.svg){#fig-descriptionpulling .absolute top=160 left=380 width="600"}
